did.abstract: Collection of material relating to the trial and execution of Italian immigrants Ferdinando Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Nicola Sacco (1891-1927) and Bartolomeo Vanzetti (1888-1927) were two Italian-born laborers and anarchists who were tried, convicted and executed on August 23, 1927 in Massachusetts for the 1920 armed robbery and murder of a pay-clerk and a security guard in Braintree, Massachusetts. The case was and still is controversial because of questions regarding Sacco and Vanzetti's guilt or innocence, and whether they received a fair trial.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Sacco and Vanzetti Collection consists of printed material (news accounts and articles during and after the trial) and photographs (stills from 1971 movie) relating to the trial and execution of Italian immigrants Ferdinando Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti. The collection is an ongoing one, created and accumulated by &scrc_name;.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Within the two series material is in no particular order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has numerous books, pamphlets, serials and other published items relating to the Sacco and Vanzetti case, which are cataloged in our rare books holdings. Please be sure to search &summitref; for these related materials.
